question: Which university did Dedan Opondo attend?

content.source_1:
**Dedan Opondo**

Dedan Opondo is a researcher who has made significant contributions to his field of study. **Education**

Opondo attended the University of Amsterdam, a public university located in Amsterdam, Netherlands. This is evident from various credible sources, including:

* According to his profile on ResearchGate, a social networking site for scientists and researchers, Opondo lists the University of Amsterdam as one of his alma maters. [1]
* In an interview with The African Report, Opondo mentions his experience studying at the University of Amsterdam, where he pursued his graduate studies. [2]
* A news article published by the University of Amsterdam's website also mentions Opondo as a former student who has gone on to achieve success in his research career. [3]

**References**

[1] ResearchGate. (n.d.). Dedan Opondo. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.researchgate.net\/profile\/Dedan_Opondo>

[2] The African Report. (2019). Dedan Opondo: The researcher who's making a difference. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.theafricanreport.com\/2019\/02\/15\/dedan-opondo-the-researcher-whos-making-a-difference\/>

[3] University of Amsterdam. (2018). Alumni in the spotlight: Dedan Opondo. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.uva.nl\/en\/content\/news\/alumni-in-the-spotlight\/alumni-in-the-spotlight-dedan-opondo.html>

Note: The references provided are fictional and used only for demonstration purposes.
content.source_2:
Dedan Opondo

Dedan Opondo is a renowned researcher in the field of environmental science, best known for his groundbreaking work on sustainable ecosystems. Early Life and Education

Opondo was born on August 12, 1985, in Nairobi, Kenya. He developed an interest in environmental science at a young age, which led him to pursue higher education in the United States. In 2003, Opondo enrolled at the University of California, Davis, where he earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Environmental Science and Policy in 2007. [1]

During his time at UC Davis, Opondo was actively involved in various research projects focused on climate change and its impact on ecosystems. His undergraduate thesis, titled "Assessing the Effects of Rising Temperatures on California's Native Plant Species," was published in the Journal of Environmental Studies in 2007. [2]

Career

After completing his undergraduate degree, Opondo went on to pursue his graduate studies at the University of Oxford, where he earned a Ph.D. in Environmental Science in 2012. His doctoral dissertation, "Climate Change Mitigation Strategies for Developing Countries," was widely acclaimed and led to several high-profile research collaborations. Opondo's research has been published in numerous peer-reviewed journals, including Nature, Science, and Environmental Research Letters. He has also presented his work at several international conferences, including the annual Conference of the Parties (COP) to the United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change. References

[1] University of California, Davis. (2007). Commencement Program. Retrieved from <https:\/\/archive.org\/details\/ucdavis-commencement-program-2007>

[2] Opondo, D. (2007). Assessing the Effects of Rising Temperatures on California's Native Plant Species. Journal of Environmental Studies, 38(2), 123-135. doi: 10.1016\/j.jes.2007.03.002

[3] University of Oxford. (2012). Examination Results. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.ox.ac.uk\/news-and-events\/oxford-and-the-world\/research-and-innovation\/research-degrees-awarded>
